TopicTitle: An early attempt at a working jet engine.

Articles.Content:
It still needs a lot of work but the basics are there. The Wheesleys turn the rear most blade which in turn drives the front blade. The Wheesleys also provide some forward thrust.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Should anyone be interested at having a look or improving the design heres the link for the download http://kerbalx.com/erasmusguy/Tubs-011

Wow cool!

Looks great, love all the new prop engines on the forums now

b-but... KSP has jet engines already o_O

Next thing I know someone's going to build a rocket engine out of rocket engines.

b-but... KSP has jet engines already o_O

Next thing I know someone's going to build a rocket engine out of rocket engines.

I wanna try that now....

Well, the main 'animated' part of a rocket engine is is power pack - it's basically a turbine hooked up to turbopumps to pump all the fuel and oxidizer to the combustion chamber (afterwards, depend on the design - some use multiple powerpacks like the SSME - which runs fuels rich on one and oxidizer rich on the other)

Other thing you could animate might be a gimbal system

Erasmusguy, I love your turbofan! btw they look nice but you don't need the fuel lines anymore.

Rocket Rocket engine: using Procedural Fairings you can make awesome rocket combustion chambers and nozzles, of gigantic proportions. But you need the mod to let engines fire inside a fairing.
Now someone build a plane that can take off and land using this baby. I'll get the fire extinguisher for the computer you try it on, cause you know it's going to burn.

b-but... KSP has jet engines already o_O

Next thing I know someone's going to build a rocket engine out of rocket engines.

That's crazy... So crazy... It might just work...
So awesome, how much thrust does it put out?

This is an awesome engine but i think it has one flaw. The blades are angled the wrong way. Any thrust the engine will produce is counter-acted by the blades pushing the engine backwards. I have fiddled with the design and it does work with the blades pitched the other way.

So awesome, how much thrust does it put out?

At the moment its too heavy to really measure but I'm working on a smaller one that gets something in the region of 100 thrust.
